description: Warm up with this easy Italian Penicillin Soup, a comforting dish that’s both nourishing and delicious. Perfect for chilly evenings, it’s a bowl of pure goodness!
ingredients: 1 cup small pasta (like ditalini or orzo)
instructions: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the minced garlic, sliced carrots, and chopped celery. Cook for an additional 3-4 minutes until the vegetables begin to soften.
Sprinkle in the dried oregano and thyme, stirring well to combine the flavors. Pour in the vegetable broth and diced tomatoes, bringing the mixture to a gentle boil.
Once boiling, add the small pasta and cook according to package instructions, usually around 8-10 minutes, until al dente.
Stir in the shredded chicken and season with salt and pepper to taste. Let simmer for another 5 minutes to heat through.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley for a vibrant finish.
tips: To enhance the flavor of your soup, consider using homemade broth for a richer taste. When selecting vegetables, opt for fresh, seasonal produce to maximize flavor and nutrition. A common mistake is overcooking the pasta; add it towards the end of cooking to maintain its texture. For storage, keep the soup in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days. To reheat, warm gently on the stove, adding a splash of water or broth if it thickens too much. For a quicker meal, you can use rotisserie chicken instead of cooking your own.

structured_content.content:
Preparing this soup is a breeze and can be done in just a few steps.

Preparation phase:
Start by gathering all your ingredients and chopping the vegetables. Dice the onion, mince the garlic, and slice the carrots and celery. This will streamline your cooking process. You can also shred the chicken ahead of time to save on prep time.
Cooking process:
Heat the olive oil in your pot over medium heat. Add the onions first, cooking until they are soft and translucent. Then, add the garlic and other vegetables, allowing them to soften and release their flavors. Pour in the broth and tomatoes, bringing everything to a gentle boil.
Finishing touches:
Once the pasta is cooked, stir in the chicken and season to taste. Let the soup simmer for a few minutes to meld the flavors together. Serve in bowls, garnished with fresh parsley for a pop of color.

note.label: Critical Tips You Must Know
note.content:
• Temperature precision: Maintain medium heat throughout cooking to prevent burning the vegetables. A good way to check is to see if the onions are translucent and fragrant.
  • Common mistake to avoid: Overcooking the pasta can lead to a mushy texture. Add it towards the end of the cooking time for the best results.
  • Perfect doneness indicator: The soup is ready when the vegetables are tender, and the pasta is al dente, with a rich aroma wafting through your kitchen.
  • Storage & reheating: Store leftovers in airtight containers for up to 3 days. Reheat gently on the stovetop, adding a splash of broth if needed to restore consistency.
